page.title: 12MANOR FARM,EMPLOYMENT
page.content: THE FARM IS 160 ACRES.ALL THE COWS WERE JERSEYS FOR DAIRYING,WITH 3 JERSEY BULLS AND 20-25 CALVES.THERE ARE 60 CERTIFICATES WON FOR MILK AND STOCK ON DISPLAY IN THE WORKERS CARAVAN.MILKING TAKES PLACE AT 5-30 AM AND 3 PM,AND LAST FOR 2 HOURS.THE COWS HAVE A MAGNETIC TAG HUNG ROUND THEIR NECK WHICH ALLOWS DELIVERY OF PROTEIN AND VITAMIN SUPPLEMENT INDIVIDUALLY COMPUTERISED.THE FIELD GRAZING IS CONTROLLED BY ELECTRIC WIRING.ALL THE MACHINERY IS MODERN.THEY SELL THEIR MILK TO THE MILK MARKETING BOARD.THE FIELDS ARE HEDGED WITH A VARIETY OF TREES:HAWTHORN,SLOW,OAK,HOLLY,WILLOW, SYCAMORE AND CONIFERS PREDOMINATED. ONE FIED SCREENED BY A WOOD IS USED TO ACCOMMODATE CARAVANNERS.THERE IS AN OLD COTTAGE NEXT TO THE HOUSE WHERE THE"LORD'S"HUSBAND LIVES AND WORKS FROM.THEY KEEP BANTOMS,AND HAVE DOGS.
